title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dauber D (2025). pkginspectr: Tidy Tools Inspecting Comparing R Package Structure. R package version 0.1.0, https://ddauber.github.io/pkginspectr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pkginspectr: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure},   author = {Daniel Dauber},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://ddauber.github.io/pkginspectr/}, }

what: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
title: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
text: pkginspectr lets peek inside R packages. inspects local folders well packages downloaded GitHub CRAN returns tidy tibbles easy work . Key functions include: inspect_package() – summarises file structure, function files, tests docs. get_code_stats() – counts lines code, comments tests. plot_pkginspect() – draws simple customisable bar charts results console.

title: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
text: can install development version GitHub:

title: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
text: Want quick overview ’s inside R package? pkginspectr lets count files, functions, components seconds.
code: library(pkginspectr)  inspect_package("ddauber/pkginspectr") ## Detected GitHub repo: "ddauber/pkginspectr" ## Detected default branch: "main" ## Inspecting pkginspectr...  ## # A tibble: 1 × 11 ##   package     version num_files num_dirs num_r_files num_function_r_files ##   <chr>       <chr>       <int>    <int>       <int>                <int> ## 1 pkginspectr 0.0.1          27        4          15                    8 ## # ℹ 5 more variables: num_non_function_r_files <int>, num_test_files <int>, ## #   num_vignettes <int>, num_docs <int>, num_data_files <int>

title: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
text: Go beyond file counts see much code really . get_code_stats() analyses line counts across package.
code: get_code_stats("ddauber/pkginspectr") ## Detected GitHub repo: "ddauber/pkginspectr" ## Detected default branch: "main" ## Using cached GitHub repo: "pkginspectr_main" ## Analysing code for pkginspectr...  ## # A tibble: 1 × 8 ##   package     version total_lines blank_lines comment_lines roxygen_lines ##   <chr>       <chr>         <int>       <int>         <int>         <int> ## 1 pkginspectr 0.0.1          1280         138            46           223 ## # ℹ 2 more variables: function_lines <dbl>, test_lines <dbl>

title: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
text: need heavy graphics — plot_pkg() renders Unicode bar charts right terminal. can customise look meet needs: bars just glyphs ANSI colours, can tweak: - colours (e.g. text_col, bar_col, etc.), - bar shape (glyph, start, end), - scale/fit (max_bars), - add custom title (title)

title: Tidy Tools for Inspecting and Comparing R Package Structure
text: Compare packages side side — perfect exploring codebases teaching. type = "metric" switches per‑package breakdown metric‑centric view (e.g., compare num_r_files, num_test_files, docs, etc. across packages). package meant small fun package useful functionality. Enjoy exploring R packages (much others’ packages)!
code: inspect_package(c(   "ddauber/pkginspectr",   "ddauber/tidycomp",   "ddauber/r4np" )) |>   plot_pkg(type = "metric") ## Detected GitHub repo: "ddauber/pkginspectr" ## Detected default branch: "main" ## Using cached GitHub repo: "pkginspectr_main" ## Detected GitHub repo: "ddauber/tidycomp" ## Detected default branch: "main" ## Detected GitHub repo: "ddauber/r4np" ## Detected default branch: "master" ## Inspecting pkginspectr... ## Inspecting tidycomp... ## Inspecting r4np...  ## num_files ## pkginspectr   ▏███▕  27 ## tidycomp      ▏████████▕  65 ## r4np          ▏█████████████▕ 105 ##  ## num_dirs ## pkginspectr   ▏███▕   4 ## tidycomp      ▏████▕   5 ## r4np          ▏██████████████████▕  21 ##  ## num_r_files ## pkginspectr   ▏███████▕  15 ## tidycomp      ▏████████████▕  26 ## r4np          ▏███████▕  15 ##  ## num_function_r_files ## pkginspectr   ▏███████▕   8 ## tidycomp      ▏█████████████▕  15 ## r4np          ▏█████▕   6 ##  ## num_non_function_r_files ## pkginspectr   ▏██████▕   7 ## tidycomp      ▏██████████▕  11 ## r4np          ▏████████▕   9 ##  ## num_test_files ## pkginspectr   ▏███████▕   8 ## tidycomp      ▏██████████████▕  15 ## r4np          ▏████▕   4 ##  ## num_vignettes ## pkginspectr   ▏▕   0 ## tidycomp      ▏▕   0 ## r4np          ▏▕   0 ##  ## num_docs ## pkginspectr   ▏██▕   4 ## tidycomp      ▏████████████▕  29 ## r4np          ▏███████████▕  25 ##  ## num_data_files ## pkginspectr   ▏▕   0 ## tidycomp      ▏▕   0 ## r4np          ▏█████████████████████████▕  21

title: Clear downloaded package cache — clear_pkg_cache
text: Deletes cache directory used pkginspectr store downloaded CRAN GitHub packages. useful freeing disk space forcing fresh downloads future analyses.

title: Clear downloaded package cache — clear_pkg_cache
Clear downloaded package cache — clear_pkg_cache
text: type string indicating cache clear. Must one : "session": temporary cache stored tempdir() (default) "persistent": long-term cache stored platform-specific user cache directory via rappdirs::user_cache_dir("pkginspectr")

title: Clear downloaded package cache — clear_pkg_cache
text: Used side effects. Invisibly returns path cleared, NULL cache found.

title: Clear downloaded package cache — clear_pkg_cache
text: can choose clear either session-level cache (temporary files created current R session) persistent cache (files stored across sessions user-specific cache directory).

title: Clear downloaded package cache — clear_pkg_cache
code: # Clear session cache clear_pkg_cache("session") #> ℹ No cache found at /tmp/RtmpyPgA41/pkginspectr  # Clear persistent cache clear_pkg_cache("persistent") #> ℹ No cache found at ~/.cache/pkginspectr

what: Compute code-level statistics for packages — get_code_stats
title: Compute code-level statistics for packages — get_code_stats
text: Analyse .R files one packages report line counts type: total, blank, comments, roxygen comments, function bodies lines test files. package name version also returned.

title: Compute code-level statistics for packages — get_code_stats
Compute code-level statistics for packages — get_code_stats
text: path character vector list local package paths.

title: Compute code-level statistics for packages — get_code_stats
text: pkginspectr_tbl one row per package containing summary line counts.

title: Compute code-level statistics for packages — get_code_stats
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Analyse the installed "stats" package get_code_stats(system.file(package = "stats")) } # }

what: Inspect packages for structure and file types — inspect_package
title: Inspect packages for structure and file types — inspect_package
text: Examine file structure one local packages return summary statistics including file counts, whether files contain functions package version.

title: Inspect packages for structure and file types — inspect_package
Inspect packages for structure and file types — inspect_package
text: path character vector list local package paths.

title: Inspect packages for structure and file types — inspect_package
text: pkginspectr_tbl one row per package containing structural summaries.

title: Inspect packages for structure and file types — inspect_package
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Inspect the installed "stats" package inspect_package(system.file(package = "stats")) } # }

what: Plot package statistics in the console — plot_pkg
title: Plot package statistics in the console — plot_pkg
text: Plots data retrieved get_code_stats(), inspect_package() returns results console.

title: Plot package statistics in the console — plot_pkg
Plot package statistics in the console — plot_pkg
text: x tibble get_code_stats(), inspect_package() combined result. type One "package" "metric". "package" shows per-package breakdown; "metric" compares packages across metric. ... Additional arguments passed plotting functions.

title: Plot package statistics in the console — plot_pkg
text: Invisibly returns x.

title: Plot package statistics in the console — plot_pkg
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Plot the statistics in pkg_data plot_pkg(pkg_data, type = "metric") } # }

title: pkginspectr 0.1.0
text: pkginspectr returns statistical insights R packages: Added inspect_package() returns key statistics R package. particular: package: package name version: version number num_files: number files package num_dirs: number directories package num_r_files: number R files package num_function_r_files: number R files containing functions num_non_function_r_files: number R files containing functions num_test_files: number test files package num_vignettes: number vignettes package num_docs: number documentation files package num_data_files: number data files package Added get_code_stats() returns code statistics R package. particular: package: package name version: version number total_lines: total number lines code blank_lines: total number blank lines comment_lines: total number comment lines roxygen_lines: total number roxygen lines function_lines: total number lines within functions test_lines: total number lines within test files Added plot_pkg() plots output inspect_package() get_code_stats() console. Users can modify colours shapes plot make uniquely . offers two modes type = "package" type = "metric": type = "package" plots package statistics multiple packages grouped package name. type = "metric" plots package statistics grouped metric. pkginspectr retrieves package information local packages CRAN, GitHub repositories. Updated README.md examples use package. Added tests functions using testthat. Create informative README.md.

title: pkginspectr 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial commit.
